intro: Tiniaria carinata, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically red or orange in color. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it thrives in cool, moist environments. Tiniaria carinata is often found growing in rocky or mountainous terrain, where it adapts well to harsh conditions. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and visually appealing species within the Malvaceae family.
